intro: Henriettea maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's henriettea, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in shaded forest understories. Its conservation status is critical due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Henriettea maguirei is of particular interest to botanists because of its unique morphology and ecological significance.
